comment.author: 26881258@N07
comment._content:
The picture shows the 1929 high wing monoplane designed by Clarence O. Prest (1896-1954) and built by Prest Airplane & Motor Co. The machine was registered as X876K. Engine was a 45 hp Anzani. The machine was identified as the 'Baby Pursuit'. Probably because of the depression there was only one sample built. There are more pictures of this machine in the collection of E.G.Rowell.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/9629540785/in/set-72157635306958286]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/9632775680/in/set-72157635306958286]

Identity could best be defined as the Prest Baby Pursuit (1929)
